info.title: ODBC Connector
info.description: The ODBC Connector allow you to integrate and map information to the cabinets in the Docutron System.

info.title: ODBC Cabinet
info.description: The Docutron Cabinet that you want to map ODBC fields to.

info.title: ODBC Add Mapping
info.description: Add mapping row allows you to add as many rows to the mapping as you want. You do not have to map each field from docutron to a corresponding field in an ODBC compliant database.

info.title: ODBC Remove Mapping
info.description: This will remove the mapping that has been established for a given cabinet.

info.title: ODBC Table
info.description: ODBC table mapping allows you to pull information from another database to populate the fields in the Docutron Repository.

info.title: ODBC Table Fieldname
info.description: The field name in the ODBC table

info.title: ODBC Foreign Key
info.description: The Key used in another table to retrieve information

info.title: ODBC Primary Search Value
info.description: The value first passed to the ODBC select statement(s). This value is typically unique.

info.title: ODBC Quoted
info.description: This field denotes type. If the value is a string you will want it to be quoted. If the value is numeric you do not typically want quotes.

info.title: ODBC Translation
info.description: If you need to translate this value to another field from earlier use type that value in here or select if from the drop down.

info.title: ODBC Docutron Fieldname
info.description: The Docutron field name is the field you want the ODBC data to populate.

info.title: ODBC Enable Mapping
info.description: This will turn on ODBC mapping to a cabinet.

info.title: ODBC Disable Mapping
info.description: This will turn off ODBC mapping to a cabinet.

info.title: ODBC Test Mapping
info.description: Test Mapping will allow you to enter an identifier for your ODBC mappings and see if the data is returned correctly.

info.title: ODBC Integration Function
info.description: Functionality for integrating to other databases

info.title: ODBC Connector Name
info.description: This field allows you to name the connector for your own reference.

info.title: ODBC Database Host
info.description: IP address of the database you want to connect to.

info.title: ODBC Database DSN
info.description: This is the connector string that will allow ODBC access.

info.title: ODBC DSN Username
info.description: ODBC username if applicable.

info.title: ODBC DSN Password
info.description: ODBC password if applicable.

info.title: ODBC Connector Type
info.description: The Connector Type is the type of DB connection you want to make such as ODBTP, MySQL, DB2...etc

info.title: Document Add
info.description: Add a document type allows folders to be more organized and the ability to search more in dept locating a specific document. Documents contain limitless indices that are have search capability

info.title: Document Edit
info.description: Editing a document will allow a document type name to be renamed and document type indices to be renamed, reordered, deleted

info.title: Document Disable
info.description: Disabling a document stops further creation of that document. Enabling a document resumes creation for that document

info.title: Document Delete
info.description: Deleting a document removes the document type and stops further creation. Existing documents of that document type will return to default documents. All document search data will be lost for existing documents

info.title: Document Name
info.description: Document name will allow you to summarize the document type

info.title: Document Index Name
info.description: Document index name are used for searching capability when searching on document types

info.title: Confirm Document Enable
info.description: Confirming document enable reassures that the document type is enabled

info.title: Confirm Document Disable
info.description: Confirming document disable reassures that the document type is disabled

info.title: Confirm Document Deletion
info.description: Confirming document deletion reassures that the document type is deleted

info.title: Confirm Document Deletion
info.description: Confirming no document deletion reassures that the document type is not deleted
